APOXI Documentation (Version 2.10)

Modules

AddOns Provides optional additions to APOXI like Auxiliary-Extensions, ADC-Extensions, GUI-Extensions, Multimedia and T9. Config Defines the common interface to the configuration-classes, which store the wished behavior and settings for APOXI dependend to a custom project.
Auxiliary Provides helper-classes for APOXI and custom projects. Devices Defines the common interface to the devices display, audio, keyboard and realtimeclock.
ADC Interface for accessing data which is stored on a variable medium like SIM, RAM, NVRAM etc. GUI = Graphical User Interface. Classes for creating windows, controls and other graphical objects needed for displaying data on the display and interaction with the user. It is recommended to read the GUI-Tutorial first.
APC = APOXI Process Control. Wrapper classes for accessing the protocoll stack. Mostly needed by ASC and ADC. Kernel Defines core-functionality of APOXI and the layer to the operating system.
ASC = APOXI Stack Control. Interface to access mobile communication requirements like GSM, GPRS and UMTS. Socket Classes for socket-handling.
AFS = APOXI File System. Bluetooth Classes for bluetooth access.
ATL = APOXI Template Layer. Template classes for IDEA concepts of the MMI.    
       

General Documentation
Module Overviews:APOXI, ADC, AES, AFS, APC, ASC, ATL, Audio, Auxiliary, Bluetooth, Devices, DRM, GUI, Http/Wap, IrDA, Kernel, LCS, Multimedia, OBEX, Suppl. Services Architecture, Services, Sockets, SyncML, Themes, USB, Voice Recognition
Concepts:Startup Concept, Shutdown Procedure, Message Routing, Service Threads, Modal vs. Modeless
Tutorials:GUI, Application Memory Meter, Suppl. Service
 
Compiler settings:Features, Defines
       

APOXI Newsletter

There is the possibility to subscribe to the APOXI newsleter service, which will inform you of interface and implementation changes in advace of official APOXI releases. This newsletter is sent out periodically and gives a brief overview of differences between the current and the upcoming versions of APOXI.

Simply subscribe by sending an email to Support_Apoxi@comneon.com with the subject SUBSCRIBE. If you dont want to receive our newsletters any longer you may unsubscribe by sending an email to the above address with the subject UNSUBSCRIBE
